items.title: Rosenior kan niet wachten om te beginnen als manager van Chelsea
items.summary: Liam Rosenior (41) is de nieuwe manager van Chelsea. De Engelsman komt over van het Franse Strasbourg en is gepresenteerd door de Londense club. Hij is de opvolger van de ontslagen Enzo Maresca, die op nieuwjaarsdag zijn cong√© kreeg.

items.title: West Brom sack head coach Mason
items.summary: Ryan Mason is sacked as head coach of West Bromwich Albion following Monday's Championship defeat by Leicester City.

items.title: Ajax-aanvoerder Klaassen deelt zijn toekomstplannen
items.summary: Davy Klaassen zou zijn spelerscarri√®re het liefst afsluiten bij Ajax. Dat vertelt de 32-jarige aanvoerder in een uitgebreid interview op VI PRO. Klaassen bespreekt daarin onder meer de afwegingen over zijn toekomst.

items.title: Sources: Man Utd eye interim until summer
items.summary: Manchester United are leaning towards installing an interim coach to replace Ruben Amorim until the end of the season, sources have told ESPN.

items.title: Waarom de duw van Garc√≠a volgens Lahoz bestraft had moeten worden
items.summary: Mateu Lahoz vindt dat de duw van Joan Garc√≠a tegen Gerard Mart√≠n bestraft had moeten worden. De doelman van Barcelona offerde zijn ploeggenoot op om een inzet van Pere Milla (Espanyol) te stoppen. 'Dat is niet toegestaan.'

items.title: Dit zijn mogelijke opvolgers van Amorim bij Manchester United
items.summary: Buitenlandsvoetbalexpert Bas van den Hoven en Sjoerd Keizer hebben het in VI ZSM over het ontslag van Ruben Amorim bij Manchester United en zijn mogelijke opvolgers. De mannen bespreken ook wat er nu op korte termijn gaat veranderen bij United.

items.title: Dick Voormekaar Podcast Extra: 'Gegoochel met aanvoerdersband moest eens klaar zijn'
items.summary: Feyenoord-watcher Martijn Krabbendam geeft in deze Dick Voormekaar Podcast Extra een update uit het trainingskamp van Feyenoord. Hij heeft het met Sjoerd Keizer over de aanvoerderskwestie, mogelijke transfers, de positie van Robin van Persie en de omstandigheden in Marbella.

items.title: Rosenior verbally agrees to be next Chelsea boss
items.summary: Liam Rosenior has all but confirmed that he will become Chelsea's next manager with his exit from Strasbourg imminent.

items.title: Sources: United sacked Amorim after Wilcox row
items.summary: Ruben Amorim was sacked by Manchester United in the aftermath of an explosive meeting with director of football Jason Wilcox on Friday, sources have confirmed to ESPN.

items.title: Man City's Gvardiol to have surgery on broken leg
items.summary: Manchester City have confirmed that Josko Gvardiol has suffered a leg fracture and is set to undergo surgery this week.

items.title: Rosenior agrees to become Chelsea manager
items.summary: Strasbourg manager Liam Rosenior says he "cannot turn down this opportunity" to take charge at Chelsea.

items.title: Watch every midweek Premier League game live on Sky
items.summary: There is another full midweek round of Premier League fixtures this week - and you can watch every match live on Sky Sports.

items.title: Loose bowling, drops and 'predictable' tactics leave England staring at defeat
items.summary: England headed into the final Ashes Test hoping to make the series score 3-2 - but a 4-1 Australia win looks the most likely scenario now after a day of toil for the tourists.

items.title: Rosenior agrees to become Chelsea head coach and says: 'I'm ready'
items.summary: Strasbourg boss Liam Rosenior has confirmed he will become the new head coach of Chelsea - and said he would not have accepted the role if he didn't think he was ready for it.

items.title: Why Man United sacked Amorim: Basic tactics, player issues, transfer frustration
items.summary: Ruben Amorim was seen as a risky choice to lead Man United's rebuild in November 2024, and ultimately, it didn't work out with news of Monday's firing. Here's how things broke down publicly and behind closed doors.

items.title: From academy to Champions League: next manager‚Äôs Manchester United in-tray
items.summary: Club must learn to play without fear and harness their young players, particularly Kobbie Mainoo, and regain a seat at Europe‚Äôs top table Whatever the protestations from Manchester United about the relationship between Ruben Amorim and the higher-ups not collapsing like a house of cards, clearly something was not right. The head coach became increasingly open that something was amiss after chats with Jason Wilcox. The director of football has not covered himself in glory at the club, but he and the chief executive, Omar Berrada, remain while another head coach departs. Conversations with potential replacements need to centre on everyone being on the same page. There were disagreements over tactics and recruitment, which created tension Old Trafford could ill afford. Nothing will be fixed overnight, meaning the incoming coach needs explicit guidelines on what is required and must offer a clear path on how tactics and style will meet expectations. Season-by-season ambitions should be set, allowing everyone to be held accountable, instead of the blame being foisted on one man. Continue reading...

items.title: Venus Williams still competitive at 45 while Nick Kyrgios falls at first hurdle
items.summary: Venus Williams lost her first singles match of 2026 in Auckland but showed she is still competitive at 45 while Nick Kyrgios fell at first hurdle in Brisbane.

items.title: Today on Sky Sports Racing: Sovereign Wealth bids to open account at Wolverhampton
items.summary: We have a busy day's racing on Tuesday with all-weather action from Southwell and Wolverhampton live on Sky Sports Racing...

items.title: Stop experiments and get manager who fits Man Utd DNA - Neville
items.summary: Gary Neville urges Manchester United to 'stop experimenting' and appoint a manager who fits the club's DNA after Ruben Amorim was sacked on Monday.

items.title: Manchester United undecided on next managerial move after sacking Ruben Amorim
items.summary: Head coach goes after outburst at Leeds game Glasner and Iraola among long-term candidates Ruben Amorim was sacked by Manchester United on Monday morning after 14 months as their head coach. He departs after a power struggle with the hierarchy over transfer policy, with Amorim demanding his ¬≠colleagues in the recruitment department ‚Äúdo their job‚Äù following Sunday‚Äôs draw at Leeds. His immediate replacement is Darren Fletcher, who takes charge as interim head coach. The Scot, a former United midfielder and the ¬≠current under-18s coach, will lead the side at Burnley on Wednesday and could remain in charge for Sunday‚Äôs FA Cup tie with Brighton. Continue reading...
